questions.question: What is the name of the document a customer fills in when they want to place an order?

choices.answer: Purchas Order
Remittance Advice Slip
Statement
Credit Note

questions.question: Explain what a delivery note is

choices.answer: Document that comes with goods, proves customer got them
Document customer sends to supplier saying goods were OK
Document customer uses to place an order
Document used to pay for an order

questions.question: Who sends a goods received note to whom?

choices.answer: Business to customer
Customer to business
Delivery Note
Purchase Order
Credit Note
Statement of Account

questions.question: What is the purpose of a credit note?

choices.answer: It's sent by a business to the customer asking for payment
Used to refund the customer for missing/damaged goods
It's used to place an order
It's a list of all transactions that took place last month

questions.question: What does it mean for a customer's account to be credited?

choices.answer: The customer pays money out
The customer owes the business more money
The customer has been refunded money into their account

questions.question: What document comes after statement of account?

choices.answer: receipt
invoice
credit note
remittance advice slip
Business sends it to the customer along with their order
Document customer sends to business to place an order
Document business sends to customer with products bought
Validate After Tax
Value Added Tax
Very Altered Tax
Document customer uses to place an order
Document customer signs when they receive an order
It is used by the customer to pay for goods ordered

questions.question: Why is it important for a business to keep records?

choices.answer: By law a business has to keep certain records
They want to fill up their filing cabinets with paper
They’re better organised
They can keep track of finances better

questions.question: Give 2 advantages of using computerised accounts instead of paper

choices.answer: Expensive to set the systems up
Less errors due to automatic calculations
Customers can log in and check payments & receipts
Time consuming to set up and staff have to be trained.

questions.question: Give 2 disadvantages of using computerised accounts instead of paper

choices.answer: Paperwork cannot be lost as it’s recorded on the system
Viruses – computers break
Computers could be hacked
Extra security with passwords and codes

questions.question: What document comes after remittance advice slip?

choices.answer: Purchase Order
Cheque
Statement of Account
Receipt
